DOC.detailed_description: DESIGN : A007 randomize , two-arm study evaluate effectiveness standard drug addiction counsel buprenorphine/naloxone enhance motivational drug counsel buprenorphine/naloxone treatment opioid addiction integrate nonintegrated HIV care set . DURATION : Subjects participate study approximately 48 week . Chart abstraction continue four year . SAMPLE SIZE : This study enroll 60 subject ( 30 per arm ) 72 week . POPULATION : HIV-1 infected opioid dependent men woman ≥18 year age initiate buprenorphine treatment opioid dependence receive primary care HIV-1 infection . STRATIFICATION : Subjects stratify screen base HIV care set ( integrate HIV care vs. nonintegrated HIV care ) INTERVENTON At entry subject randomize one following : ARM A : Standard drug addiction counsel + buprenorphine / naloxone ARM B : Enhanced behavioral motivation counsel + buprenorphine / naloxone The three primary outcome : 1 . Cessation illicit opioid use 2 . Reduction high risk behavior 3 . Improved HIV therapy adherence
